alert.note: Alert for Mercer (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 4:14PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mercer, north central Burlington, west central Monmouth and eastern Bucks Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 414 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bordentown, or 7 miles south of Trenton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Trenton, Ewing, Florence, Hightstown, Bordentown, Tullytown, Allentown, Edinburg, Crosswicks, White Horse, Windsor, Florence-Roebling, Twin Rivers, Mercerville-Hamilton Square, Jobstown, Columbus, Lawrenceville, Georgetown, Morrisville and Fieldsboro. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 6 and 8A. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 10. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 52 and 70. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southern, central and northern New Jersey...and southeastern Pennsylvania.
